DCStatus.name: SID
DCStatus.comment: Sequence ID. If your device is e.g. boat speed and heading at same time, you can set same SID for different messages to indicate that they are measured at same time

DCStatus.name: DCType
DCStatus.comment: Defines type of DC source. See definition of DCType

DCStatus.name: RippleVoltage
DCStatus.comment: DC output voltage ripple in V

DCBatStatus.name: SID
DCBatStatus.comment: Sequence ID. If your device is e.g. boat speed and heading at same time, you can set same SID for different messages to indicate that they are measured at same time

Temperature.name: SID
Temperature.comment: Sequence ID. If your device is e.g. boat speed and heading at same time, you can set same SID for different messages to indicate that they are measured at same time

Temperature.name: TempInstance
Temperature.comment: This should be uniq at least on one device. May be best to have it uniq over all devices sending this PGN

Temperature.name: SetTemperature
Temperature.comment: Set temperature in °K. This is meaningfull for temperatures which can be controlled like cabin, freezer, refridgeration temperature

FluidLevel.name: FluidInstance
FluidLevel.comment: Tank instance. Different devices handles this a bit differently. So it is best to have instance unique over all devices on the bus

FluidLevel.name: FluidType
FluidLevel.comment: Defines type of fluid. See definition of FluidType

FluidLevel.name: Level
FluidLevel.comment: Tank level in % of full tank
